name: Payment Plan Downsells
description: Offer the same product with flexible payment terms—spread cost over time, offer financing, or use the 7-step downsell framework. Customers pay full price (or more) but with less upfront cost.

headline_patterns: Get Everything You Want—Pay Over Time
offer_structure: Step 1: Present full price, offer discount if they pay in full (reward prepayment)
Step 2: If no, offer 3rd party financing, credit card, or layaway options
Step 3: If no, offer half now, half later (split on paycheck schedule)
Step 4: Check desire level (1-10 scale). If 8+, continue. If 7-, consider feature downsell
Step 5: Offer split into three payments (1/3 down, schedule on paychecks or monthly)
Step 6: Offer evenly spread payments over service duration (e.g., 16-week program = 16 weekly payments)
Step 7: As last resort, offer Free Trial with completion requirements
upsell_sequence: During payment plan: Offer original discount price if they pay balance in full today
Mid-plan: Offer periodic upsells for additional features at discount (only paid if they complete plan)
followup_sequence: Day 0: Welcome, explain payment schedule, align with paycheck dates
Day 3: Value reinforcement—remind them why they bought
Day 7: Quick win—help them see results to increase completion
Payment reminder: 2 days before each payment, remind and provide value
Completion: Celebrate when they finish paying, offer upsell to next tier
metrics: Close rate increase (should go up with payment plans)
Paid-in-full rate (should NOT decrease—if it does, you have a problem)
Payment plan completion rate (aim for 70%+ completion)
Total revenue per lead (should increase significantly)
30-day profit boost (more cash collected from 'no' customers)

name: Trial With Penalty
description: Let customers try your product/service for free as long as they meet specific requirements (show up, do homework, complete actions). If they don't comply, they pay fees. Uses 'avoiding fees' as motivator rather than 'winning money back.'

headline_patterns: Try It Free—Pay Only If You Don't Show Up
offer_structure: Step 1: Get their credit card FIRST (to 'complete account profile'—'that's just how we've always done it')
Step 2: THEN explain the trial terms and what they must do to keep it free
Step 3: Sell 'staying and paying'—explain how long it takes to hit their goal (X months minimum)
Step 4: Sell consumption commitments—what they must do: show up, do homework, attend calls, post progress
Step 5: Explain fees—missed workout $XX, missed call $XX (associate fees with non-consumption, not with penalties)
Step 6: Require sales consultation attendance (3 check-ins = upsell opportunities)
upsell_sequence: Check-in 1 (Week 1-2): If they like it, upsell to paid (set up billing, offer upgrade)
Check-in 2 (Week 3-4): If they hate it, diagnose why and offer better fit (turn frown upside down)
Check-in 3 (End of trial): If they didn't use it, reach out multiple times, offer fee waiver if they return, or offer better product
followup_sequence: Day 0: Welcome, set expectations, explain how to avoid all fees and stay free forever
Day 1: First action reminder—get them to complete first requirement immediately
Day 3: Quick win—help them see value so they WANT to upgrade
Mid-trial check-ins: Make offers based on usage (like it = upsell, hate it = swap, not using = re-engage)
End of trial: Convert to paid if they love it, or charge accumulated fees if they didn't comply
metrics: Card capture rate (should be very high—card first, terms second)
Trial activation rate (did they actually start using it?)
Compliance rate (% completing requirements to avoid fees)
Trial-to-paid conversion (can double your conversions: close 3/10 on main, 4/10 on trial = 6 total)
Long-term customer value (trials who convert tend to stay longer)

name: Feature Downsells
description: Remove features, quantity, quality, or optional components to lower price and find the best deal for the customer. Remove highest-value features first so customers 're-upsell' themselves when they see the value of what's missing.

headline_patterns: Let's Find the Right Package for Your Budget
Pick What You Need, Pay for What You Use
offer_structure: Step 1: Remove features from HIGHEST to LOWEST value (so they see what they're losing)
Step 2: After removing each feature, show new lower price and ask 'How about now?'
Step 3: Temperature check after 2 downsells (1-10 scale). If 8+, keep going. If 7-, try payment plan.
Step 4: Position yourself as helpful guide finding the BEST DEAL for them (not just cheapest)
Step 5: People see the VALUE in removed features AFTER seeing price difference (they re-upsell themselves)
Step 6: If they like a combo but not the price, START PAYMENT PLAN downselling (very effective)
upsell_sequence: After downsell purchase: Mid-experience upsell to add back removed features when they see value
If they choose 'minimum': Later offer free orientation or training on removed features, then upsell
For current customers: Feature downsell BEFORE they cancel—becomes 2nd highest LTV group
followup_sequence: Day 0: Welcome, reinforce their choice was smart (best deal for them)
Week 1: Deliver massive value with what they bought
Week 2-3: Show examples of what premium features enable (plant seed)
Month 1: 'How's it going?' check-in—diagnose if they're hitting limits
Month 2: Offer upgrade to add back specific features they need now
metrics: Downsell conversion rate (should capture 20-40% of 'no' customers)
Re-upsell rate (% of downsell customers who upgrade later)
Customer satisfaction (feature downsell customers often have HIGHER satisfaction—you helped them)
Retention rate of downsell customers vs. cancellations prevented
